channel.title: Linked Lists

item.title: Linked Lists
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I actually wrote this for c# a few days ago, when I have time later on ill see whats wrong with yours.

meanwhile…

[code]public void RemoveItem(T item)
{
LinkGen current;
LinkGen previous = null;
for (current = list; current != null;
previous = current, current = current.TailList)
{

            if (current.HeadList.Equals(item)) 
            {
                if (previous == null)
                {
                    list = current.TailList;
                }
                else
                {
                    previous.TailList = current.TailList;
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Linked Lists
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Basically I was writing some functions to do shit with a linked list in c but I failed with the delete part.
This is what I got so far:

int del(struct cock *root, int i) {
    if (i == 0) {
        struct cock *curr = root;
        curr = root->next;
        free(root);
        root = curr;
        
    } else {
        struct cock *curr = root;
        int j;
        for (j = 0; j < i - 1; j++) {
            if (curr->next != NULL) {
                curr = curr->next;
            } else {
                break;
            }
        }
        free(curr->next);
        curr->next = curr->next->next;

    }
    return 1;
}

So basically ignore the else block of the method because that works perfectly.

It’s the part that deletes the first node of the linked list that is borked. I assumed to delete the first item you simply change the root node to the 2nd item. I tried this but nothing happens. Could someone lead me to the correct direction.

edit, I just realised this is more to do with passing pointers to functions but oh well

Read full topic
